revised_title: Hydrocarbon Gels: Thermodynamics and Rheological Behavior of Elasto-Viscous Systems Under Stress
tldr: The authors studied the behavior of hydrocarbon gels under stress, observing an increase in free energy and the formation of anisotropic effects. They found that these systems exhibit unique properties, such as acting as semi-permeable membranes with a concentration gradient across them, generating a species of osmotic pressure. The study also highlighted the differences in the rheological behavior of these gels compared to Newtonian fluids.
